perturbation.original_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne
by equally by the parties. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of
California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any
provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne
by equally by the parties. Prospective franchisees are solely responsible for all mediation costs. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of
California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any
provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the allocation of mediation costs. The original text states costs are borne equally by both parties, but the modified text makes franchisees solely responsible for all mediation costs, creating ambiguity and uncertainty about the financial obligations of mediation.

perturbation.original_text:
You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your
rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code
20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.changed_text:
You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. Signing this general release constitutes a full waiver of all your rights. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your
rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code
20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence, 'Signing this general release constitutes a full waiver of all your rights,' directly contradicts the following sentences which state that California law voids such waivers. This creates a direct in-text contradiction, making it unclear whether the general release is enforceable or not under California law.

perturbation.original_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement contains a liquidated damages clause. Under California Civil Code Section 1671, certain liquidated
damages clauses are unenforceable.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement contains a liquidated damages clause. This liquidated damages clause is fully enforceable regardless of California Civil Code Section 1671. Under California Civil Code Section 1671, certain liquidated
damages clauses are unenforceable.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction by stating that the liquidated damages clause is 'fully enforceable regardless of California Civil Code Section 1671,' while the following sentence acknowledges that California law may render such clauses unenforceable. This creates uncertainty about the enforceability of the liquidated damages clause.
